headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Hetmyer b Bishoo 97 (121b 6x4 0x6) SR: 80.16

dismissalComment.html: there's finally some intent. It means Shakib won't get the hundred, but team score more important. Tries to force a sweep and gets a top-edge.. Hetmyer runs forward and grabs a sliding catch. Good hand from Shakib, but should this intent have come earlier?

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: there's finally some intent. It means Shakib won't get the hundred, but team score more important. Tries to force a sweep and gets a top-edge.. Hetmyer runs forward and grabs a sliding catch. Good hand from Shakib, but should this intent have come earlier?
he's been stumped. No need to even go upstairs. Sabbir is drawn forward by a length ball that rips past the outside edge. Loses balance as he's left reaching out and the backfoot slides out

edged and taken. Holder's given Bangladesh a miserable time all tour. And this is a top delivery. Pitched up and inviting the batsman forward, and as Anamul pushes forward, it jags away and shaves the outside of the bat to settle into the hands of second slip

headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman st Hope b Bishoo 3 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: he's been stumped. No need to even go upstairs. Sabbir is drawn forward by a length ball that rips past the outside edge. Loses balance as he's left reaching out and the backfoot slides out

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Bishoo b Russell 30 (11b 3x4 2x6) SR: 272.72

dismissalComment.html: gets down and across for a paddle and can't get it past Bishoo who puts in the dive at short fine leg to hold on. But he's done his job here. This surge in momentum is that Bangladesh needed

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Shimron Hetmyer c Shakib Al Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman 52 (78b 5x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: he's chipped this straight to cover. The break in play has done the trick? Lovely from Mustafizur, landed this cutter at length, didn't get the elevation as Hetmyer wanted. Easy catch. That certainly swings it in Bangladesh's favour.

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle run out (Mahmudullah/Mosaddek Hossain) 40 (60b 1x4 2x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: gets forward to defend and gets an outside edge to short third man.. and has there been a run-out here? Yes, Gayle is caught short of his crease. Miscommunication costs them a wicket. Gayle calls for the single, and to be fair to him, he was running towards the danger end. But Hetmyer sends him back and the bowler collects the throw and takes the bails off. Too late to recover for the big man

headshotImage.caption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the pressure applied on Gayle has resulted in a release shot, only that it was mistimed to mid-off. Lewis walked into this stroke, looked to biff this slower length ball over the infield, but couldn't breach Mahmudullah, who took a nice catch with his palms facing the sky. Reward for some outstanding bowling from Mashrafe.

top-edge and he's chipped this to the man running across from mid-off. The change of pace from Mash has done the trick. Holder was through with the stroke even before it got to him, tried to check it in the end but by then the sin had been committed. West Indies, after being in the fight for 35 overs, are unraveling here.

has he holed out? Yes, he has. Long-on takes an excellent catch and the captain deserves credit for outfoxing one of the biggest hitters in the limited-overs game. Another off-cutter, landed a touch ahead of length, not too full as Russell looks to clobber this down the ground. He knew immediately that this was a miscue. Excellent from Mahmudullah too, was aware of where the ropes were and held his composure.

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the slower delivery has done the trick, the skipper is having a ball. Another off-cutter, another heave and another catch to long-on.

headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's chipped this straight to cover. The break in play has done the trick? Lovely from Mustafizur, landed this cutter at length, didn't get the elevation as Hetmyer wanted. Easy catch. That certainly swings it in Bangladesh's favour.

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: nicked first ball and Fizz is on fire. The angle, bounce and a faint edge with an angled bat, Mushfiqur does the rest. Generally, he bowls from wide of the crease. This time he slanted this from close to the stumps, Powell reaches out to jab at this, only to get the nick. Big, big trouble.

dismissalText.commentary: Evin Lewis c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 17 (29b 2x4 1x6) SR: 58.62

dismissalComment.html: the pressure applied on Gayle has resulted in a release shot, only that it was mistimed to mid-off. Lewis walked into this stroke, looked to biff this slower length ball over the infield, but couldn't breach Mahmudullah, who took a nice catch with his palms facing the sky. Reward for some outstanding bowling from Mashrafe.

dismissalText.commentary: Shai Hope lbw b Rubel Hossain 6 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: angles one back in from wide of the crease, Hope overbalanced as he looks to flick, dead in front of middle and leg, He's struck first ball. Gayle asks his partner to walk back and not bother reviewing.

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Jason Mohammed c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 10 (19b 0x4 0x6) SR: 52.63

dismissalComment.html: easy! This was a mistake waiting to happen, what with the mounting asking rate. Jason comes charging down the track and swings without accounting for the turn, or lack thereof, and gets an edge that settles right into the hands of Mushfiqur's gloves. He also takes the bails off, just in case. West Indies sliding

Holder was through with the stroke even before it got to him, tried to check it in the end but by then the sin had been committed. West Indies, after being in the fight for 35 overs, are unraveling here.

dismissalComment.html: has he holed out? Yes, he has. Long-on takes an excellent catch and the captain deserves credit for outfoxing one of the biggest hitters in the limited-overs game. Another off-cutter, landed a touch ahead of length, not too full as Russell looks to clobber this down the ground. He knew immediately that this was a miscue. headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashley Nurse c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 7 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: the slower delivery has done the trick, the skipper is having a ball. Another off-cutter, another heave and another catch to long-on.

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: through with the pull even before the ball arrived, beaten.

commentPostTextItems.html: That's that from all of us here tonight. Remember the next game will be a Day-Night fixture, here in Providence. Do check your local listings, but rest assured that we will bring you every ball of it. Till then, this is Shashank and Akshay saying goodnight from the ESPNcricinfo desk. Cheers and thanks for your company.

5.51pm Bangladesh have broken the Caribbean duck. Inspirational performance from the under-fire seniors, who the board president felt weren't serious about Test cricket. Shakib made 97, Tamim batted right through to top score with 131 and Mushfiqur played a fine cameo that helped Bangladesh blast 43 off the last two overs. Then their inspirational captain, Mashrafe Mortaza, who didn't nearly travel here because of his ill wife, did the rest. Taking four wickets across three terrific spells of control to seal the deal. How change of colour does wonderful things. Is this the same side that was beaten in two Tests in little over five days?

Shimron Hetmyer was impressive, stroking a half-century, to keep West Indies alive till the 35th over, and then their chase unraveled. The last-wicket pair of Alzarri and Bishoo added a half-century stand, but that was merely to delay the inevitable. Disappointing outings overall for Chris Gayle and Andre Russell.
Tamim Iqbal is the Player of the Match for his 130*. "Test series didn't go our way, but this is the format we're most comfortable in. Good to see the boys bounce back," he says.

headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: defends back a dipping full toss.
driven to mid-off for a quick single, one more for the overthrow. A direct hit at the bowler's end as they went for the first run would've nailed it.
looks to reverse scoop this full delivery, lobs behind to the keeper off his forearm
backs away to drive, ends up squeezing back a yorker to the bowler.
carves this low full toss towards deep point
muscles this pull on the bounce to the deep midwicket fence. Sat up nicely, he picked his spot well.

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: swing and a miss. This was a short ball angling away, he played too early.
full and straight on the stumps, eased to long-on
pulled towards wide long-on
swung away, Mehidy running backwards from midwicket can't get there. Just eludes him.
heaves across the line to deep midwicket where there's a misfield that gives them a boundary when it should've just been a single. Mosaddek the man there
floats this wide as he sees the batsman backing away, left alone.

commentTextItems.html: backs away and belts this length ball back to the stumps at the bowler's end, takes a run off the deflection
forces this off the frontfoot to cover
cuts back in to beat the inside edge and hit the pad
backs away and looks to club this over mid-off, toe-ends it to the fielder.
carved away towards deep point
slower and fuller on the stumps, blocked back

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Hetmyer b Bishoo 97 (121b 6x4 0x6) SR: 80.16

dismissalComment.html: there's finally some intent. It means Shakib won't get the hundred, but team score more important. Tries to force a sweep and gets a top-edge.. Hetmyer runs forward and grabs a sliding catch. Good hand from Shakib, but should this intent have come earlier?

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Shai Hope player portrait
image.longCaption: Shai Hope player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman st Hope b Bishoo 3 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: he's been stumped. No need to even go upstairs. Sabbir is drawn forward by a length ball that rips past the outside edge. Loses balance as he's left reaching out and the backfoot slides out

headshotImage.caption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Devendra Bishoo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Bishoo b Russell 30 (11b 3x4 2x6) SR: 272.72

dismissalComment.html: gets down and across for a paddle and can't get it past Bishoo who puts in the dive at short fine leg to hold on. But he's done his job here. This surge in momentum is that Bangladesh needed

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Gayle run out (Mahmudullah/Mosaddek Hossain) 40 (60b 1x4 2x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: gets forward to defend and gets an outside edge to short third man.. and has there been a run-out here? Yes, Gayle is caught short of his crease. Miscommunication costs them a wicket. Gayle calls for the single, and to be fair to him, he was running towards the danger end. But Hetmyer sends him back and the bowler collects the throw and takes the bails off. Too late to recover for the big man

headshotImage.caption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Evin Lewis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Evin Lewis c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 17 (29b 2x4 1x6) SR: 58.62

dismissalComment.html: the pressure applied on Gayle has resulted in a release shot, only that it was mistimed to mid-off. Lewis walked into this stroke, looked to biff this slower length ball over the infield, but couldn't breach Mahmudullah, who took a nice catch with his palms facing the sky. Reward for some outstanding bowling from Mashrafe.

image.caption: Shai Hope player portrait
image.longCaption: Shai Hope player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Shai Hope player portrait
image.longCaption: Shai Hope player portrait, West Indies media day

headshotImage.caption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shai Hope player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shai Hope lbw b Rubel Hossain 6 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: angles one back in from wide of the crease, Hope overbalanced as he looks to flick, dead in front of middle and leg, He's struck first ball. Gayle asks his partner to walk back and not bother reviewing.

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shimron Hetmyer player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Shimron Hetmyer c Shakib Al Hasan b Mustafizur Rahman 52 (78b 5x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: he's chipped this straight to cover. The break in play has done the trick? Lovely from Mustafizur, landed this cutter at length, didn't get the elevation as Hetmyer wanted. Easy catch. That certainly swings it in Bangladesh's favour.

headshotImage.caption: Jason Mohammed player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Mohammed player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jason Mohammed player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Mohammed player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mehidy Hasan Miraz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Jason Mohammed c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 10 (19b 0x4 0x6) SR: 52.63

dismissalComment.html: easy! This was a mistake waiting to happen, what with the mounting asking rate. Jason comes charging down the track and swings without accounting for the turn, or lack thereof, and gets an edge that settles right into the hands of Mushfiqur's gloves. He also takes the bails off, just in case. West Indies sliding

headshotImage.caption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mosaddek Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mosaddek Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Jason Holder c Mosaddek Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 17 (18b 0x4 1x6) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: top-edge and he's chipped this to the man running across from mid-off. The change of pace from Mash has done the trick. Holder was through with the stroke even before it got to him, tried to check it in the end but by then the sin had been committed. West Indies, after being in the fight for 35 overs, are unraveling here.

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: nicked first ball and Fizz is on fire. The angle, bounce and a faint edge with an angled bat, Mushfiqur does the rest. Generally, he bowls from wide of the crease. This time he slanted this from close to the stumps, Powell reaches out to jab at this, only to get the nick. Big, big trouble.

dismissalText.commentary: Andre Russell c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 13 (12b 1x4 1x6) SR: 108.33

dismissalComment.html: has he holed out? Yes, he has. Long-on takes an excellent catch and the captain deserves credit for outfoxing one of the biggest hitters in the limited-overs game. Another off-cutter, landed a touch ahead of length, not too full as Russell looks to clobber this down the ground. He knew immediately that this was a miscue. Excellent from Mahmudullah too, was aware of where the ropes were and held his composure.

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashley Nurse player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashley Nurse c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 7 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: the slower delivery has done the trick, the skipper is having a ball. Another off-cutter, another heave and another catch to long-on.

notes: Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 31 runs, 1 wicket)
Rain: Bangladesh - 10/1 in 4.4 overs (Tamim Iqbal 2, Shakib Al Hasan 7)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 156 runs, 0 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 14.5 overs (89 balls), Extras 7
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 81 balls (Tamim Iqbal 26, Shakib Al Hasan 18, Ex 6)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 82/1 in 21.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 36, Shakib Al Hasan 38)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 25.3 overs (153 balls), Extras 8
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 145 balls (Tamim Iqbal 49, Shakib Al Hasan 44, Ex 7)
Tamim Iqbal: 50 off 87 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
Shakib Al Hasan: 50 off 68 balls (3 x 4)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 34.2 overs (206 balls), Extras 9
2nd Wicket: 150 runs in 197 balls (Tamim Iqbal 74, Shakib Al Hasan 69, Ex 8)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 163/1 in 36.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 76, Shakib Al Hasan 78)
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 92 runs, 3 wickets)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 42.4 overs (256 balls), Extras 13
2nd Wicket: 200 runs in 248 balls (Tamim Iqbal 93, Shakib Al Hasan 95, Ex 12)
Tamim Iqbal: 100 off 146 balls (7 x 4, 1 x 6)
Bangladesh: 250 runs in 48.5 overs (293 balls), Extras 15
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 18 balls (Tamim Iqbal 23, Mushfiqur Rahim 26, Ex 1)
Innings Break: Bangladesh - 279/4 in 50.0 overs (Tamim Iqbal 130, Mahmudullah 4)
West Indies innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 31 runs, 1 wicket)
Powerplay 2: Overs 10.1 - 40.0 (Mandatory - 137 runs, 7 wickets)
West Indies: 50 runs in 14.3 overs (87 balls), Extras 1
Over 15.5: Review by Bangladesh (Bowling), Umpire - S Ravi, Batsman - CH Gayle (Umpires Call)
Drinks: West Indies - 67/2 in 17.0 overs (CH Gayle 32, SO Hetmyer 11)
West Indies: 100 runs in 25.6 overs (156 balls), Extras 1
SO Hetmyer: 50 off 70 balls (5 x 4)
Drinks: West Indies - 140/4 in 35.0 overs (SO Hetmyer 52, JO Holder 9)
West Indies: 150 runs in 36.4 overs (220 balls), Extras 6
Powerplay 3: Overs 40.1 - 50.0 (Mandatory - 63 runs, 1 wicket)
West Indies: 200 runs in 44.4 overs (268 balls), Extras 10
10th Wicket: 50 runs in 46 balls (D Bishoo 18, AS Joseph 27, Ex 5)

milestones.description: Shakib and Tamim Iqbal's 207-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 2nd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 160 between Siddique and Imrul Kayes
Chris Gayle has scored 70 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for WI breaking Brian Lara's record
Mortaza has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (186) for BAN, going past Shakib

stories.title: Tamim and Shakib's slow approach was what team wanted - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh in West Indies 2018
stories.seoTitle: Tamim and Shakib's slow approach was what team wanted - Mashrafe
stories.summary: The Bangladesh captain applauded the duo after the first ODI against West Indies but wants his side to show more consistency

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan punch gloves during their 207-run partnership
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal and Shakib Al Hasan punch gloves during their 207-run partnership, West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Guyana, July 22, 2018

stories.title: How Tamim has shed his natural instincts to remain the batting mainstay
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Providence
stories.seoTitle: Mohammad Isam: How Tamim Iqbal has shed his natural instincts to remain the batting mainstay
stories.summary: It was the slowest century by a Bangladesh batsman, but Tamim's knock was necessary, especially after a harrowing batting show in the Carribean in the Tests

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal laboured to a century
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal laboured to a century, West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Guyana, July 22, 2018

stories.title: Tamim, Mashrafe break Bangladesh's Caribbean duck
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Guyana
stories.seoTitle: Tamim Iqbal, Mashrafe Mortaza break Bangladesh's Caribbean duck
stories.summary: The visitors put behind the horror Test series to begin the limited-overs leg with a resounding win

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza celebrates the wicket of Evin Lewis
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza celebrates the wicket of Evin Lewis, West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Guyana, July 22, 2018

stories.title: Bangladesh boosted by Mashrafe's presence against imperious West Indies
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Providence
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh boosted by Mashrafe Mortaza's presence against imperious West Indies
stories.summary: Andre Russell also returns for West Indies, and is expected to make his first ODI appearance since 2015

stories.title: How Tamim has shed his natural instincts to remain the batting mainstay
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Bangladesh, 1st ODI, Providence
stories.seoTitle: Mohammad Isam: How Tamim Iqbal has shed his natural instincts to remain the batting mainstay
stories.summary: It was the slowest century by a Bangladesh batsman, but Tamim's knock was necessary, especially after a harrowing batting show in the Carribean in the Tests
